DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to validate the Glasgow-Blatchford score for the stratification of patients with upper gastro-intestinal hemorrhage. This score is easy to calculate. It is mainly based on the hemoglobin, blood pressure and blood urea. if the score is zero, the bleeding is very low risk and the gastrointestinal endoscopy may be delayed and performed as an outpatient.
DOC.brief_title: Glasgow-Blatschford Score Validation in Digestive Hemorrhage
DOC.criteria: To be admitted in the university hospital for a gastrointestinal hemorrhage (vomiting of red or black blood or melena) Age under 18 Pregnancy Hemorrhage during hospitalisation red rectal bleeding No consent signed
